turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hello there.  It's evening here.  How are you?  Hope you had a wonderful day!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes it has been a great day, thank you for asking.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Awesome.  I'm just settling down for the evening with my children after a late Labor Day meal preparing for school week. Do you have children?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: No I am 18.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I remember when I was 18 some years ago.  Enjoy those years and make them the very best years.  Are you active in your community?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes I am in college and volunteer to help feed the poor in my city.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That's awesome.  Every time I am out and about I look for ways to bless someone somehow. Every day is an opportunity to help someone less fortunate.  Have you heard of the Save The Children organization?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes I have. Can you tell me how much of the donation actually reaches the children in need?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Save the Children donates nearly 90% of every dollar to their mission.  They are very upfront with letting you know where your donation is going.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Can I choose where my donation is sent to?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes not only are you able to choose.  You have the ability to take part in their Sponsor A Child program by either choosing someone in the US or in another country.  I love the idea of staying connected to one or two so that i can see the progress and how I can specifically make a difference.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Do I have to make recurring payments?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: There's multiple ways to make payments.  Although recurring payments are recommended, it is completely optional.  Would you consider Sponsoring a Child on a long term basis during college?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Possibly. I'm not sure if I can afford a long term plan.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: The great thing about Save the Children they have the option to even send a gift such as a water kit, a soccer ball and even a rabbit.  I really like this idea because it makes it not all about the money.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That's very nice, I like the idea of sending food or water.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes, it is so sad that we have children that still are in need of food and water.  As a single parent of 5 children, I know how rough it can get to provide even the basics but I am still moved to help others because of my own experiences.  Many don't realize just a little can go a long ways.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes that's very true. How much should a donation be? $1? $10? $100?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Of course the more the greater.  I'm the type of give even when it hurts.  I definitely trust Save the Children to do what they say they will to make sure to reach the children.  How much would you be willing to donate?  I remember you saying that you are in college even $2 would help a lot.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yeah I could do a dollar or two.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That's awesome.  Your donation would be directly deducted from your task payment.  You can choose any amount from $0 to all your payment ($2).
